title: 2024 (2025) O/L results released
byline: The results of the 2024 (2025) GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination were released today, Examinations Department Commissioner General A.K.S. Indika Kumari Liyanage said.

title: Govt should be ashamed over mishandling of U.S. tariff deal: Dayasiri
byline: Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara today accused the government of mishandling tariff negotiations with the United States, claiming Sri Lanka had failed to secure meaningful benefits from the recent tariff reductions announced by U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Sri Lanka awaits details on underworld arrests in Malaysia
byline: Despite reports that several Sri Lankans, including notorious underworld figures Manudinu Padmasiri Perera alias ’Kehelbaddara Padme’ and ’Commando Salintha’, have been arrested in Malaysia, local authorities are yet to receive official confirmation, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Hashan Tillakaratne’s wife Apsari in hot water after her interview, clad in AirLanka saree
byline: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Hashan Tillakaratne’s wife Apsari, who was once an airhostess of SriLankan airlines is in hot water after her interview with a website, clad in a saree worn by airhostess of the SriLankan airlines formerly known as AirLanka.

title: Maithripala, Ranil, entire Yahapalana Cabinet in hot water over SLIIT scam: Minister
byline: Former Presidents Maithripala Sirisena, Ranil Wickremesinghe and the entire Cabinet of the Yahapalana government are in hot water over an alleged scam pertaining to SLIIT, which is an entity under the Mahapola Scholarship Fund, Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe informed Parliament today.

title: 73.45% qualify for A/Ls, 2.34% fail all at O/L exam
byline: Following the release of the 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination results, 2.34% of candidates failed all subjects, while 73.45% of students who sat for the exam qualified for the G.C.E. Advanced Level, Commissioner General of Examinations A.K.S. Indika Kumari Liyanage announced today.

title: Sri Lankans among 149 arrested in ’scam call centre’ raid in Pakistan
byline: Pakistan police have arrested 149 people including two Sri Lankans in a raid on a scam call centre, the country’s National Cyber Crime Investigation Agency (NCCIA) said on Thursday.

title: 2025 A/L exam dates announced
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, A.K.S. Indika Kumari, has announced that the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will be held from November 10 to December 5, 2025.

title: Trump’s Tariff Blow and the Free Trade Myth: Sri Lanka’s Economic Trap Exposed
byline: In a shocking move that sent tremors through Sri Lanka’s export sector, U.S. President Donald J. Trump announced a 30% tariff on Sri Lankan apparel imports into the United States. With over 45% of the country’s merchandise exports tied to the apparel sector, the announcement is more than a trade adjustment - it is a strategic body blow to the Sri Lankan economy.

title: Original Birkin bag sells at auction for record $10 million
byline: Scuffed, scratched and stained, this black leather Birkin bag just sold for €8.6 million ($10 million), with fees, becoming the most expensive handbag to ever sell at auction. The hammer fell at a winning bid of €7 million ($8.2 million).

title: Over 7,000 dansals inspected on Esala Poya Day: PHI union
byline: Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) carried out inspections at 7,067 dansals across the country yesterday in connection with the Esala Poya Day, Union Secretary Chamil Muthukuda announced.

title: Tariff tensions tighten thread in SL’s textile trade
byline: Sri Lanka’s apparel sector, a key pillar of the island’s export economy, yesterday raised red flags over the United States’ move to impose a 30 percent reciprocal tariff on all Sri Lankan products starting 1 August

title: Sri Lanka’s recovery at risk without growth commission: CEPA
byline: A new report from a group of eminent economic thinkers has proposed the formulation of an independent growth commission to guide Sri Lanka towards sustained economic recovery and transformation.
